thread.title: Eugenie Bouchard honours Super Bowl bet by taking fan on a date to an NBA game
thread.title_full: Eugenie Bouchard honours Super Bowl bet by taking fan on a date to an NBA game - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Eugenie Bouchard honours Super Bowl bet by taking fan on a date to an NBA game

organizations.name: new england patriots atlanta falcons eugenie bouchard

text:
Eugenie Bouchard honours Super Bowl bet by taking fan on a date to an NBA game The tennis star head out on the town in New York with the 20-year-old student Share Comments By Mick Gadd 00:29, 16 FEB 2017 Updated 00:37, 16 FEB 2017 Sport (Photo: @geniebouchard/Twitter) Share Comments Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Eugenie Bouchard said she would and we never doubted her for a moment.
The tennis ace has honoured a lost bet by heading out on a date with John Goehrke, the New England Patriots fan who called Bouchard out on Twitter when she prematurely celebrated the Atlanta Falcons' Super Bowl victory.
Goehrke bet her a date that the Patriots would pull off an historic comeback, they did, and the rest as they say in history.
"Just met my 'Super Bowl Twitter Date' John. On our way to the (Brooklyn Nets) game!" Bouchard tweeted from New York on Wednesday night.
Far from being put out by the bet, Bouchard appears to be enjoying herself.
Earlier in the day she said she was looking forward to heading out with the total stranger after getting her hands on the new Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue, in which she features.
John, a 20-year-old marketing student, beams a smile as he poses for a selfie with Bouchard in the back seat of a car on their way to the game.
The pair are continuing the sporting theme of their faux courtship, taking in the Milwaukee Bucks visit to the Barclays Center.
It's not yet known who has picked up the tab.
Patriots fan John Goehrke blagged his way into a date with Bouchard (Photo: Splash News) How it all came about will go down in history.
As Atlanta led 21-3, Bouchard was keen to tell her followers on social media that she knew the Falcons would win .
No team had ever overcome such a deficit in Super Bowl history, so it seemed like a long-shot when 20-year-old marketing student John Goehrke replied to her tweet with the message: "If patriots win we go on a date?"
Little did he expect to get a reply from the 2014 Wimbledon finalist, let alone a date, until when, at the end of overtime and with the Patriots completing an historic 34-28 overtime win, Bouchard replied: "So... where do you live?"
Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Who is Eugenie Bouchard? Share this video Watch Next Tom Brady inspired the Patriots to an historic comeback at this year's Super Bowl final (Photo: Getty Images North America) Read More Former Manchester United and England star Rio Ferdinand being courted by the NFL "I thought maybe there was a chance she would respond, but I thought there was no chance she’d actually agree to it," Goehrke told the Kansas City star.
"Once the game ended, that’s when everything started blowing up.
“I started getting texts from my friends that knew. My Twitter started blowing up. It was the first time I had to start turning my notifications off.”
Read More Eugenie Bouchard to go on date with fan after betting that Atlanta Falcons would win Super Bowl Before the date, Bouchard said: "It’s fun and I’m going to follow through with it, because I want to honor my word," the 22-year-old said.
"I’ll fly him out (to a tournament), but besides that he has to be the gentleman and, you know, organize a fun date night."
